clause_text: Mrs. Baker adopted many cats
She lived in the narrator's neighborhood
Mrs. Baker was known as the cat lady
Mrs. Baker had adopted many cats
The narrator was a tomboy
Mrs. Baker had a grandson
The grandson had poor manners
Mrs. Baker was known as the cat lady in the neighborhood
The narrator's neighbor had a grandson
who tried to befriend the narrator
The grandson left a note
saying he was running away from Mrs. Baker's nagging
The narrator helped Mrs. Baker strategize
to find her grandson
Mrs. Baker was the resident cat lady in the narrator's neighborhood.
The narrator's interaction with Mrs. Baker's grandson was unfriendly.
The grandson left a note saying he was running away.
The narrator and Mrs. Baker searched for the grandson near the old mill.
Mrs. Baker was the resident cat lady in the neighborhood.
The narrator's interactions with Mrs. Baker's grandson were strained due to his poor manners.
Mrs. Baker came to the narrator's treehouse seeking help to find her grandson.
The narrator and Mrs. Baker found the grandson sitting in a tree with a comic book.
Mrs. Baker had adopted many cats.
Her grandson tried to befriend the narrator.
The narrator and Mrs. Baker searched for the grandson together.
The narrator stayed out of sight after the sheriff's warning.
